questions.question: Tools such as context diagrams, decision tables and system flowcharts are usually used in the:

choices.answer: A Decision-making stage of the system development cycle
Design stage of the system development cycle
Implementation stage of the system development cycle
Testing stage of the system development cycle

questions.question: For which of the following are information systems designed?
Which list shows the items in order of increasing usefulness to users?
which of the following contain egs of output in the form of info rather than raw data?
which is the technique LEAST likely to be used by the junk filter to ID this email?

choices.answer: Identifying addresses not in the user's pc address book
responding 2 words in the subject/body email using a list
checking validity of sender email address
recognising the financial offer as unrealistic/dishonest

questions.question: what is the key advantage of computerised databases over manual databases?

choices.answer: sorting & searching DB with a large # of records

questions.question: How many entries would be output from the following SQL statement?

choices.answer: 2 text fields, date field, one drop down menu
three text fields, one drop down menu

questions.question: From top to bottom above the most likely encoding and decoding conversions shown are as follows

choices.answer: analog to analog; analog to digital; analog to digital
analog to analog; analog to digital; digital to digital
analog to digital; analog to digital; analog to digital
analog to digital; analog to analog; digital to digital

questions.question: One difference between a context diagram and a data flow diagram is that in a context diagram:

choices.answer: The entire system is represented by a single circle
all flow lines are towards processes
a complex system is shown in a modular form

questions.question: Which statement best describes the function of a router when compared to a switch or bridge?

choices.answer: It has greater control than a switch or bridge
It responds quicker than a switch
It responds quicker than a bridge
It is identical in operation to both a switch and a bridge
